column4: Im looking to play 720p x264 mkv on my acer aspire one connected to a bigger display.  I used to be able to do this in windows with core AVC but i switched to ubuntu recently and cannot find an equivilant.  someone yesterday suggested sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-extras vlc but it hasnt impproved the playback    Any ideas?
Lighta:  nope.  its another vid player?  sudo apt-get xrand?
is to configure your screen output, wait I'll give you exact sentance laptop or normal comp ?
xrandr --output VGA1 --mode 720x264 (if this mode exist on your card)

my res is 1920*1080 now, but when i play the file im getting lots of lost frames like the netbook cannot handle it.  they didnt work in windows without a plugin installed which reduced the sys requirements for 720p vids
just run command xrandr this will display mode you can have on your card
